Toggle Menu

salt.states.mdadm

Managing software RAID with mdadm

A state module for creating or destroying software RAID devices.

/dev/md0:
  raid.present:
    - level: 5
    - devices:
      - /dev/xvdd
      - /dev/xvde
      - /dev/xvdf
    - chunk: 256
    - run: True

absent

Syntax

salt.states.mdadm.absent(
								name
								)

Verify that the raid is absent

Arguments

Name Description
name

The name of raid device to be destroyed

Details

/dev/md0:
  raid:
    - absent

present

Syntax

salt.states.mdadm.present(
								name,
								level,
								devices,
								**kwargs
								)

Verify that the raid is present

Changed in version 2014.7.0.

Arguments

Name Description
name

The name of raid device to be created
level

The RAID level to use when creating the raid.
devices

A list of devices used to build the array.

Details

Example:

/dev/md0:
  raid.present:
    - level: 5
    - devices:
      - /dev/xvdd
      - /dev/xvde
      - /dev/xvdf
    - chunk: 256
    - run: True
